'''Shaili Chopra''' is the Senior Editor and Lead Female Anchor at [[ET Now]], the Economic Times Business News Channel. Shaili anchors the primetime shows and key interviews.
==Biography== Shaili Chopra was born in Jalandhar on 21 July 1981 in Punjab to Anil & Suman Chopra. Father Anil Chopra is a fighter pilot in the Indian Air Force in the rank of Air Marshal. In 1998, Shaili finished her schooling from [[Air Force Golden Jubilee Institute]],New Delhi. Shaili finished her master's degree in Broadcast and Television from 2002 batch, The Asian College of Journalism, [[Chennai]]. Her writings and poetry are also published in [[Times of India]], [[Indian Express]], [[The Pioneer (Indian newspaper)|Pioneer]], among various other magazines and websites like The South Asian Women's Forum and even an anti war news blog.<ref>"[http://sawf.org/bin/tips.dll/getcontributions?user=Sawf&contributor=Shaili+Chopra&class=Poetry&subclass=Original&pn=Contributors] Shili's Biograph", Retrieved on December 23, 2007.</ref>
==Professional Life==
Shaili worked with [[NDTV 24 x 7]] as Markets & Corporate Affairs Editor and NDTV Profit as the Senior News Editor-Corporate for over 5 years and now works at ET NOW. She has won many awards including News Television Award for the Best English Reporter across India in 2007<ref>http://www.dancewithshadows.com/media/cnn-ibn-ndtv.asp</ref> and later in 2008, her business-golf show Business on Course, won the Best Show Award.<ref>http://www.ndtvprofit.com/2008/08/10120830/NDTV-bags-top-honours-at-telev.html</ref> In March 2010, Shaili Chopra won the Best Business Anchor award and was felicitated with FICCI's Woman Achiever Award.<ref>http://www.indiainfoline.com/Markets/News/Young-FICCI-Ladies-Organisation-salutes-women-achievers-across-India/4818077033</ref> Shaili has also covered international events like the G-20, WEF@Davos, The Bretton Woods conference 2011, India Economic Summit and the World Retail Congress. Shaili's interviews include [[Warren Buffett]], Citigroup's [[Vikram Pandit]], Nobel Laureate [[Amartya Sen]], former Finance Minister [[P Chidambaram]], Blackrock's Chairman Larry Fink, Deutsche Bank's [[Anshu Jain]], Microsoft's [[Steve Ballmer]], PepsiCo's [[Indra Nooyi]], Standard Chartered's Asia Chief Jaspal Bindra, ICICI's [[KV Kamath]], HDFC's [[Deepak Parekh]], New Vernon's Arshad Zakaria, Soc Gen's Global Private Banking Head Daniel Truchi, Citibank's Former India Chief & KKR CEO Sanjay Nayar, Citi's India Head of Global Banking Pramit Jhaveri, Morgan Stanley's India MD Aisha De Sequeira, other famous Indian bankers like Uday Kotak, Nimesh Kampani, Hemendra Kothari.Global corporate faces like Rothchild's [[Lady Lynn]], Ikea's [[Anders Dahlvig]], WEF's Klaus Schwab, [[Anand Mahindra]], Kumar Mangalam Birla, [[Rahul Bajaj]], [[Sunil Mittal]] and many others.
Among policy makers ministers like [[Kamal Nath]], Commerce Minister [[Anand Sharma]], Aviation Minister [[Praful Patel]] and the Finance Minister and Trade Ministers of Netherlands, France and Australia.
Shaili Chopra and her colleague [[Shivnath Thukral]] also reported live from outside the Taj Mahal Hotel in Mumbai during the [[2008 Mumbai terrorist attacks|terror attacks of 26/11]].<ref>http://www.hindustantimes.com/News/smallscreen/TV-s-hits-and-misses-of-terror-attacks/Article1-356208.aspx</ref> Shaili Chopra along with NDTV launched the pathbreaking series Ideas For Change in the aftermath of the 26/11 attacks on the Taj. [http://entertainment.oneindia.in/television/top-stories/news/2008/ndtv-ideas-for-change-041208.html] This series reached out to people, CEOs, politicians, social groups alike to report on solutions to the changing threat of terror. It mobilised every single CEO who mattered to speak up.The series followed it up with Ideas For Change (Corporate Governance in light of the Satyam fraud) and with Ideas For Change This Election.
